title: 1,000 True Fans
author: Kevin Kelly
review: The essay that launched a thousand creator economies. Still the clearest articulation of how the internet changes who can make a living from their work.

title: A coat check ticket, a magic spell
author: Robin Sloan
review: It brings me much sadness to know that Robin Sloan has abandoned experimnenting with crypto, because his work on Amulets remains one of my favorite things ever created. This is a great breakdown of the project and also insights into someone who's crypto-curious and skeptical at the same time.

title: Startup Slop
author: Jihad Esmail
review: On the futility of performative entrepreneurship.

title: Running a Paid Membership Program
author: Craig Mod
review: Probably some of the most honest and interesting words ever written about paid subs online. I send this to every creator I know who's thinking of paywalling their work.

title: Who Stole Beauty from Men?
author: Julie Fredrickson
review: Maybe unexpectedly niche for this page, but I've been struggling with dry and flaky skin for awhile and following the mid-tier recs here (The Ordinary) completely fixed all of my problems.
